title: Decision Scientist I (Estratégia de Portfólio)
description: O isaac é a maior plataforma de soluções financeiras feita para escolas. Impulsionamos as instituições oferecendo receita garantida e proporcionando mais flexibilidade de pagamento para as famílias.Nosso objetivo é facilitar a gestão financeira, acabando com a dor de cabeça e permitindo que a escola consiga focar na missão deeducar, dedicando mais tempo e recursos para tirar os planos do papel.Nos últimos 4 anos, já ajudamos mais de2.000 escolas,garantimos mais deR$5biem mensalidades garantidas, e ajudamos a aumentar em 9% o número de matrículas em nossas escolas parceiras.A cultura do isaac incentiva a autonomia, a mão na massa, o trabalho em equipe e o uso de dados para construir soluções inovadoras.Temos muito para construir e transformar na Educação brasileira, e você pode fazer parte dessa revolução, vivenciando o impacto do seu trabalho na sociedade!Vem com a gente?Decision Scientist I (Estratégia de Portfólio)Nosso papel é ajudar as diversas áreas do isaac resolvendo problemas munidos de forte contexto do negócio e conectando com o mundo dados.Decision Scientists são pessoas que têm um perfil analítico e conseguem passar por todos os estágios como: identificar problemas, levantar hipóteses, estruturar soluções e traduzir números em decisões que afetam diretamente diversas áreas de negócios.Dentro da estrutura de rentabilidade, nosso papel é apontar o caminho mais eficiente e escalável para alcançarmos nossos objetivos e garantir a sustentabilidade financeira do isaacDentro do time de portfólio, somos responsáveis por mensurar e projetar o risco da nossa carteira, desdobrando os resultados das nossas análises para os demais times de rentabilidade em metas palpáveis e insights claros. Nossa rotina inclui construir diversos relatórios para alta liderança isaac e Arco sobre nosso negócio, trazendo aprendizados e perspectivas para nossa rentabilidade.Vem com a gente?No dia a dia você irá:Identificar e estruturar um problema;Levantar hipóteses;Analisar os dados para validar hipóteses e ter embasamento na tomada de decisão;Tomar decisões com riscos calculados;Formular políticas para o negócio;Monitorar experimentos, implementação e resultados;Criticar números e decisões sendo um guardião de uma cultura de decisões baseadas em dados;Comunicar suas descobertas para lideranças e apoiar as diferentes áreas de negócios em decisões estratégicas;Trabalhar no seu dia a dia com uma diversidade de temas e pessoas com diferentes backgrounds.Para participar do nosso processo você precisa ter:Nós não temos requisitos de formação específica nem de background. O que precisamos que todos os analistas tenham é:Capacidade de estruturar e resolver problemas complexosAlta capacidade analíticaNoção sobre negóciosVontade de aprender sempreSaber trabalhar bem em equipes diversasBoa habilidade de comunicaçãoAqui não exigimos que os analistas tenham profundo conhecimento em Data Science, mas antes de se aplicar a essa vaga, é importante saber queferramentas para manipulação de dados serão viabilizadores do seu trabalho no isaac.Somos uma empresa de educação e por conta disso, a vontade de aprender sempre é muito importante para nós. Aprender novas linguagens, novos modelos, novas plataformas, novas metodologias, são parte importante do nosso trabalho como DS.Diferenciais:Conhecimento de algumas linguagens de programação para algoritmos de data science (em especial Python).Conhecimentos de estatística como Sample Sizing, Teste de Hipótese, etc.Conhecimento em ferramentas de visualização de dados como Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc#MaisDiversidadeAcreditamos que em um ambiente diverso e inclusivo nossaspessoas serão mais felizes, engajadase commais chances de atingir o seu máximo potencial. description: Job DescriptionJoin the team redefining how the world experiences design.Hey, hello, hiya, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.Where And How You Can WorkOur headquarters is in sunny Sydney, Australia, but our team spans the globe. Since we don’t have a physical campus in Brazil, this role is fully remote—giving you the flexibility to do your best work from wherever you thrive.What You’d Be Doing In This RoleAs Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.At The Moment, This Role Is Focused OnBuild the Data Foundation for LATAM Design and build dashboards from scratch that bring visibility to our most important LATAM metrics—across user growth, retention, monetization, campaign performance, and more.Own LATAM Data Strategy End-to-End Define how we track success across the region by setting clear and relevant targets. Build frameworks and KPIs that help us measure impact and make better decisions—tailored to local market nuance.Partner with Local, Regional, and Central Teams Act as the bridge between our LATAM teams (marketing, country managers, community), and global product and data functions. Ensure local insights are reflected in global priorities, and ensure a two-way flow of local and global insights.Tell the Story Behind the Numbers Craft clear, actionable narratives using data. Turn complex insights into simple stories that inspire action—whether with product teams, regional leadership, or the whole company.Identify Problems Before They’re Obvious Proactively surface growth bottlenecks, user behavior shifts, or product mismatches in the region—so we’re always one step ahead.Support Product & Experimentation Initiatives Work closely with product teams to help design and measure new feature performance, local experiments, and A/B tests in LATAM markets.You're probably a match ifYou have strong SQL and data wrangling skills; able to work independently with large, messy datasets and exposure to experimentation and A/B testing frameworksYou are familiar with Canva’s data stack (Looker, Snowflake, Mode, Netspring)You have proven experience building dashboards and tracking frameworks from the ground upYou can showcase the ability to define and track key metrics across the user journey (e.g., signups, MAU, retention, monetization)You have prior experience partnering with cross-functional teams (marketing, product, growth, ops), and using data to influence decisionsYou bring strong communication and storytelling skills—you make data land, not just show upYou have hands-on experience using AI in your work to drive greater impactYou are a strategic thinker who can zoom out and prioritize what really moves the needle and you’re comfortable in ambiguity and take ownership without waiting for a briefYou have experience working in, or analyzing LATAM markets or other global marketsYou bring an understanding of mobile analytics and behavioral funnels and are experienced in supporting product teams or market localization initiativesYou ideally have working proficiency in Spanish and/or Portuguese to help us better support our local communityAbout The TeamAt Canva, we’ve just unlocked a huge opportunity in LATAM: for the first time, we’re building a dedicated regional team to understand, grow, and serve the unique needs of our users across LATAM.As the Regional Data Lead for LATAM, you’ll be the first dedicated analytics voice for this region—shaping how we understand our users, measure what matters, and build a data-informed growth strategy that connects our local markets with our global product teams.If you’re excited about building from scratch, partnering closely with teams across marketing, product, and community, and helping one of the world’s fastest-growing platforms localize with care—this is your chance.What's in it for you?Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.Here's a Taste Of What's On OfferEquity packages - we want our success to be yours tooInclusive parental leave policyAn annual Vibe & Thrive package to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & moreFlexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personallyCheck out lifeatcanva.com for more info.Other Stuff To KnowWe see AI as a powerful amplifier of creativity and technology at Canva. We’re evolving how we assess AI skills in our Technology hiring experience - you’ll tackle interactive, real-time challenges that reflect the kind of work we do. In some interviews, you may also be asked to solve a problem using an AI tool to show how you approach challenges with tech by your side. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.Show moreShow less

title: Principal Data Scientist
description: City :Sao PauloState :São Paulo (BR-SP)Country :Brazil (BR)Requisition Number :42627Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Principal Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities. Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in-office and remote work.Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respectDrive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficientDo What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainablyOverview:We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Principal Data Scientist with strong expertise in pricing optimization to join our growing team. As Principal Data Scientist, you will be a critical technical lead of the Business Technology Data and Analytics team, responsible for leading the construction and optimization of large-scale models to solve business problems and communicate the value to the business stakeholders. You will also be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize data analytics initiatives, driving significant impact throughout our global value chains.Essential Functions:Main AccountabilitiesDesign, create, test and implement complex modeling and algorithmic systems that drive value throughout the organization.Responsible for leading large-scale data science initiatives from POC to productionDesign and structure reusable codebase utilizing data science best practice and supports the sustainability of our technical portfolio.Collaborate with various stakeholders to understand business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions.Work closely with Data Scientists, Analysts and Data Engineers to build and deliver valuable analytical solutions.Communicates and document the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed to a variety of audience.Ensure timely deliverables and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over timeCommunicate data insights and value articulation to stakeholders.Serve as a technical lead and point of contacts to product managers, business partners and collaborators.Contribute to a culture of learning through technical mentoring and tools sharing.Major Opportunities and DecisionsThe problems faced are difficult and often complex and multi-dimensional. Decisions and problem-solving are guided by policies, procedures, and business plan; Anticipates and interprets internal or external issues and recommends solutions/best practices. Applies acquired expertise to analyze and solve problems without clear precedent.Management/LeadershipManages operational plans, large projects and/or processes with limited oversight from manager. Leads and/or participates with comparable influence in large projects/initiatives; AND/OR provides leadership to professionals and support. Contributes to short to mid term (1-3 years) talent optimization plans to execute on strategies in job area.Key Relationships, Stakeholders & InterfacesStakeholders of this role include Leadership team members, business leaders as well as technical experts making highly developed interpersonal & soft skills are important. One should be tech-savvy and business-savvy as well, should understand business, different types of data analytics technologies, apply methods to valuable authentication, prevent frauds. It is crucial to shape data products in alignment with corporate strategy and provide data insights leading to business directions.Minimum Requirements:Post graduate degree in STEM field or bachelor’s degree with a combination of 5 + years of experience as in Data Science or Computer Science, IT or a related field.Strong foundations in math, analytics and computer science, knowledge of machine learning methods, statistical models, advanced data science programming.5+ years of hands-on working experience / fluency in Python and SQL.Comfortable with scripting language such as bash.Experience writing reusable and maintainable code with version control, ability to transform a project from POC to production.Experience building and deploying resilient data and modeling pipelines in the cloud environment.Experience with at least one major cloud platform (GCP, AWS or Azure), with preference to GCP services including but not limited to Compute Engine, Big Query, Cloud Run, and Cloud Composer.Creative and self-motivated. Demonstrate drive to learn new skills and solve challenging problems.Act as a great team player in a global environment, take responsibility to consistently build better solutions both in technical quality and business impact.Preferred Qualifications:Good understanding of software development, best practice, and ability to apply that to machine learning projects, including unit tests, CI/CD integration.Experience using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) such as Terraform.Experience implementing Kubernetes and Docker (or similar container engine) solutionsObtained Google Cloud Professional certifications in areas such as MLE, data engineer, DevOps engineer.Experience working with customer analytics and pricing optimization, and domain knowledge in global agri-business is a plus.At Bunge (NYSE: BG), our purpose is to connect farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed and fuel to the world. As a premier agribusiness solutions provider, our team of :37,000 dedicated employees partner with farmers across the globe to move agricultural commodities from where they’re grown to where they’re needed—in faster, smarter, and more efficient ways. We are a world leader in grain origination, storage, distribution, oilseed processing and refining, offering a broad portfolio of plant-based oils, fats, and proteins. We work alongside our customers at both ends of the value chain to deliver quality products and develop tailored, innovative solutions that address evolving consumer needs. With 200+ years of experience and presence in over 50 countries, we are committed to strengthening global food security, advancing sustainability, and helping communities prosper where we operate. Bunge has its registered office in Geneva, Switzerland and its corporate headquarters in St. Louis, Missouri. Learn more at Bunge.com.Every day our people exemplify these values, which represent Bunge at its core:We Are One Team – Collaborative, Respectful, InclusiveWe Lead The Way – Agile, Empowered, InnovativeWe Do What’s Right – Safety, Sustainability, With IntegrityIf this sounds like you, join us! We value and invest in people who believe in our purpose and are excited to live it every day – people who are #ProudtoBeBungeShow moreShow less
